note.name: Appearance
note.text: Appearing as a fair, youthful woman with silvery and blue eyes which appear to sparkle like the stars in the night sky. Her skin is as pale as milk, with shimmering long white hair.

note.name: Backstory
note.text:
Vilani Vaelith, Silent Starlight. Derived from an old elven word for Seeker of the Veil.
Born into the noble Vaelith family, a lineage steeped in the ancient traditions of the Circle of Stars, Vilani was expected to follow a path of celestial duty—guiding her people through wisdom and prophecy, as all in her family have done for generations. But unlike her regal older sister Elthira, who gracefully bears the weight of leadership, or her proud younger brother Selvaya, who upholds family tradition with fervent loyalty (and quiet jealousy), Vilani felt the stars calling her elsewhere. Driven by curiosity, not duty, she uncovered a forgotten constellation in her family's archives—one that hinted at lost wonders and ancient truths scattered across the world. Unable to ignore its pull, she left behind the comfort of nobility and the safety of home, embarking on a wandering pilgrimage beneath the open sky. Now, Vilani follows starlit paths through forgotten ruins, wild frontiers, and cosmic mysteries—not for gold or glory, but for the thrill of discovery and the whisper of the stars. Her journey is as much a rebellion as it is a search for truth… and perhaps one day, her siblings and family will understand why she had to go.

note.name: Allies
note.text:
Elthira Vaelith – The Wise Star The eldest of the Vaelith siblings and heir to the house, Elthira has always been a poised, graceful figure—one who carries the family’s celestial legacy with quiet strength. Her name, meaning “Wise Star,” reflects the role she plays within the Circle of Stars: a guiding light, a stabilizing force, and the voice of reason in turbulent times. Raised with reverence and responsibility, Elthira has become the face of noble duty. Yet behind her composed exterior lies a hidden ache. Elthira secretly admires Vilani’s decision to leave—to explore, to wander, to follow her curiosity beyond the walls of their ancestral halls. She once dreamed of such freedom herself, but those dreams were quietly folded away beneath layers of duty. Though she cannot follow, she watches over her younger sister from afar, offering what support she can through quiet acts of protection, and the unspoken hope that one day, Vilani returns to the family with tales of her many adventures.
Selvaya Vaelith – The Star’s Oath Selvaya, the youngest of the Vaelith siblings, was born into a legacy that never truly had space for him. In a matriarchal house where power and recognition pass through the women of the line, he grew up striving to prove his worth—not just as a son, but as a protector of their name. His name, “Star Oath,” is a vow he lives by: to uphold the family's traditions, safeguard their reputation, and ensure the legacy endures. When Vilani left, Selvaya took it as a personal betrayal. He could not understand why she would abandon her place, her people, and her duty for what he saw as a selfish indulgence in whimsy. His frustration is not only moral—it’s rooted in jealousy, though he would never admit it. His sisters are admired, destined for greatness, while he fights for scraps of recognition. He believes in the importance of family above all, and Vilani’s rebellion shakes the very foundation of what he’s built his identity around. Whether his path will lead to reconciliation or confrontation remains to be seen.

note.name: Treasure
note.text: Always on the look out for interesting treasure.

note.name: Enemies
note.text:
House Maevron. Rooted in the druidic traditions that emphasize the earth over the stars. View the Vaeliths as arrogant dreamers. A traditionalist druid faction opposing Vilani's more exploratory and cosmic path.
House Liraenor. They compete through cosmic scholarship and magic; claim their bloodline has a truer connection to the stars.
House of Duskryn. Masters of secrets and manipulation; claim the stars favor their interpretation of prophecy.

note.name: Organizations
note.text: House Vaelith. House Maevron. House Liraenor. House of Duskryn.
